abstract_summ: Preventing, identifying and treating early VAP can increase the chances of successful treatment in patients with COVID-19.Secondary bacterial infections occurred in 13.9% (5/36) of critical ill patients of COVID-19.We describe the presentation of the COVID-19 patients on the emergency department, the development of the disease, and the treatment of these patients on the ICU.This manuscript aims to highlight the risk of Ventilator-Associated Bacterial Pneumonia (VAP) in COVID-19 inpatients.All the five patients had been admitted to ICU and received mechanical ventilation before episode of bacterial infection.On average, 5% of the COVID-19-positive patients have severe respiratory symptoms.Diagnosis can be challenging because signs may be vague, clinical pathology parameters are nonspecific, and the gold standard for diagnosis is invasive: histopathology of affected tissue.
title_summ: Feline Infectious Peritonitis: Update on Pathogenesis, Diagnostics, and Treatment.[In-hospital treatment of COVID-19 patients].COVID-19: An Alert to Ventilator-Associated Bacterial PneumoniaSecondary bacterial infections in critical ill patients of COVID-19
title_abstract_phrases: Preventing, identifying and treating early VAP can increase the chances of successful treatment in patients with COVID-19.Secondary bacterial infections in critical ill patients of COVID-19Secondary bacterial infections occurred in 13.9% (5/36) of critical ill patients of COVID-19.We describe the presentation of the COVID-19 patients on the emergency department, the development of the disease, and the treatment of these patients on the ICU.COVID-19: An Alert to Ventilator-Associated Bacterial PneumoniaThis manuscript aims to highlight the risk of Ventilator-Associated Bacterial Pneumonia (VAP) in COVID-19 inpatients.This article discusses the developments in the understanding of this disease as well as the progress in diagnosis and treatment.[In-hospital treatment of COVID-19 patients].Covid-19 infection is now a pandemic disease.All the five patients had been admitted to ICU and received mechanical ventilation before episode of bacterial infection.On average, 5% of the COVID-19-positive patients have severe respiratory symptoms.
